guides/e_lifetime_errors:
Lifetime Errors (´；ω；｀)

The Problem

When your PostgreSQL connection outlives your Rust borrow checker's patience

error[E0597]: `conn` does not live long enough
   --> src/main.rs:69:4
    |
69  |    let row = conn.query_one("SELECT waifu FROM anime", &[])?;
    |               ^^^^ borrowed value does not live long enough
420 | }
    | - `conn` dropped here while still borrowed

"Solution"

  1. Wrap everything in Arc>>>
  2. Cry into your mayonnaise jar
  3. Give up and watch anime instead

functions/e_borrow_checker:
The Borrow Checker (⌐■_■)

How It Works

PostgreSQL: "Here's a mutable connection!"

Rust: [IMAGE: NO PERMISSION MEME]

Common Workarounds

These are terrible ideas:

  • unsafe { std::mem::transmute(conn) }
  • Using 137 nested RefCells
  • Switching careers to JavaScript
errors/e_mom_yelling:
ERROR: Mom Yelling (╬ Ò﹏Ó)

ERROR CODE: 0xDEADBEEF
SEVERITY: Maximum volume
LOCATION: Basement
QUERY: SELECT * FROM real_world WHERE responsibility = true;

Suggested Fixes

Option 1: Pretend Not To Hear

Works until she unplugs the router

Option 2: "Im working on a startup!"

Buys you 3-6 months
